hook.text: 880 million people worldwide have vision impairments. Your font choices include or exclude them.

buildup.text: Minimum body text: 16px on web. Below that, most users struggle, not just those with low vision.

discovery.text: Avoid thin font weights (100-200) for body text. Low contrast between stroke and background hurts readability.

twist.text: All-caps text is harder to read because uppercase words lose their distinctive shape (word shape model).

climax.text: WCAG requires 4.5:1 contrast for normal text and 3:1 for large text. Test every color combo.

punchline.text: Accessible type isn't a favor. It's a professional standard.

quiz.question: What is the recommended minimum body text size for web?
